lines.text: No, hold, hold it Jerome. Jerome. Don't, uh, don't pull down on a cop.
Do what he says, Jerome.
[Jerome shoots the cop]
Oh, are you crazy? Now you just made me an accessory.
Mike, there's a garbage truck blockin' the alley and no garbage in sight.
Yeah I know, I wish Miller were in it.
Forget it. He's no cop.
What d'ya mean he's no cop?
Look at his gun. Tell me that's not a 9mm Star, and I'll kiss your ass.
And just from that you knew that?
San Francisco Police Department packs regulation Smith & Wesson .38's. So...
Heh, heh. C'mon Jerome.
I just wanna get closer to George.
(laughs) So you find him and you zap him. Will that change Weyburn's mind? Will that give you back your knee and your elbow?
No, no, but, uh, wherever they are I know they'll be a lot happier.
You know, it must be true about you people. You don't care if you die, right?
Of course, we do. It's in the manner of living and of dying one finds relevance.
So that's how you're gonna do it. You're gonna go back to your country to die. I mean, who's gonna keep you alive when you're there?
I don't need an army. I'm not a revolutionary, nor do I want power.
We've heard that before.
Oh, wait a minute. I, I understand it now. Y'see, he wants to go back to die on his own native soil. It's that salmon-up-the-river shit.
Shoot him!
He happens to have a gun at your head.
You wouldn't shoot an 18 year old girl. Would you?
(gleefully) You bet I would. You bet I would.
You just retired, Mike. Enjoy it.
You all look alike, you young mercenaries. No matter what country.
Well we're all idealists. Y'think we do it for the money?

[looking at fake taxi cab]
Well it, uh, blends in all right. What else has it got that makes it so charming?
Gas tank is tucked under the rear seat. Steel plate wrap-around, reinforced bumpers. And it's a fully blown engine.
How come we never used it before?
I just got it, Mike. Some union guy put it all together, bulletproof glass, and then they shot him in bed. I got it from his widow.
Chung, I thought somebody had taken care of him.

It's just a question of time. But it's not in the national interest that it should happen either today, or for that matter tomorrow. It's especially central that it doesn't happen under any circumstances within the confines of the United States. What happens to him Friday, after he's gone, is no longer our concern.

Weyburn will never put you back in harness. No way, Mike. And, uh, if you don't mind, don't drop around the shop, huh? The higher-ups don't like it, and it makes the boys nervous, y'know, clump-clumping around. Doesn't fit in with the Muzak.

[examining an ailing plant in Weyburn's office]
Talking to them isn't enough. Their longevity lies within the context of your communication.
Oh, I know, I know, I know. I even recite the love sonnets of Elizabeth Barrett Browning to the poor thing.
Hmmm. It's probably dying of boredom.
Danny, how are you?
Did you ever consider my dear Cap how much energy you've wasted over your 47 years mustering up that good fellow smile and that insincere handshake?
Damn it, Mike! You're so busy doing their dirty work, you can't tell who the bad guys are!
anybody who tries to hurt me!

They're all tryin' to hurt you Mike! All the goddam power systems! All the wheelers and dealers at the top with their gin and fizzes! They need guys like you to do their bloodletting, while they're busy making speeches about freedom and progress! They're all full of bullshit! There's not one power system that really cares about its civilians!

I checked with the staff doctor, Mike. I also called a friend who is considered to be one of the best orthopedic surgeons in the world. He says, given a year, you may be able to walk up a flight of stairs. That leg of yours will never be anything but a wet noodle.
Got lots of girls?
Yeah, tons o' them. I send my extras over to Turkey for harem duty.
My father was a minister. That's what he wanted me to be.
Who cares?
[laughs derisively]
Who cares?

[as Yuen Chung and his daughter are arguing in Madarin]
Hold it! Hold it! Let's keep it clean and simple. No subtitles please!
Good morning, Mac.
You look OK for a robot.
Yeah, well, I ain't with all the 3 and 1 oil.
Damn it, Mike, you're so busy doin' their dirty work, you can't tell who the bad guys are!

[invitingly]
I'm a virgin.
Well, uh, that's really nice. I really don't have time for your confessions right now. Look kid, I don't want to sound too harsh, but I really don't give a shit.
Every country, if hopes to become a democracy, needs at least one voice raised in opposition. I happen to be selected. Let just one other person hear my voice. That is a beginning! It's enough.
all the other sheep I've kept have always been running away from their countries. You're the first one that I've met that's jumping back into the frying pan.
That's what I was telling you before. You're risking your life, keeping him alive, and getting him back someplace where they're going to finish him off anyway.
